name: Hanging Coffins
description: Ancient Igorot burial tradition. Coffins are hung on limestone cliffs to bring the deceased closer to ancestral spirits.
cultural_protocols: Respect the site; do not touch coffins; hire a local guide.
safety_guidelines: Trail can be slippery; wear sturdy shoes.

name: Sumaguing Cave
description: Sagada's biggest and most popular cave, known for stunning rock formations and underground river.
entrance_fee: ₱100 environmental fee + ₱500 guide fee (up to 5 pax)
cultural_protocols: Considered a sacred place; ask permission before photographing.
safety_guidelines: Spelunking requires physical fitness; follow guide instructions.

name: Bontoc Museum
description: Museum preserving indigenous heritage, featuring artifacts, textiles, and a reconstructed village.
cultural_protocols: No photography indoors. Respect the artifacts.

name: Maligcong Rice Terraces
description: Beautiful stone-walled rice terraces hand-carved by the Bontoc people.
cultural_protocols: Ask permission before entering private paddies.
safety_guidelines: Slippery when wet; stay on paths.
